<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	This report contains forward-looking statements that involve risks and uncertainties. The statements contained in this report that are not purely historical are forward-looking statements within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933 and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. When used in this report, the words &#x201C;plan,&#x201D; &#x201C;target,&#x201D; &#x201C;anticipate,&#x201D; &#x201C;believe,&#x201D; &#x201C;estimate,&#x201D; &#x201C;intend&#x201D;, &#x201C;expect&#x201D; and similar expressions are intended to identify such forward-looking statements. Such forward-looking statements include, without limitation, the statements regarding Gold Resource Corporation&#x2019;s strategy, future plans for production, future expenses and costs, future liquidity and capital resources, future dividends and estimates of mineralized material. All forward-looking statements in this report are based upon information available to Gold Resource Corporation on the date of filing this report, and the company assumes no obligation to update any such forward-looking statements. Forward looking statements involve a number of risks and uncertainties and there can be no assurance that such statements will prove to be accurate. Gold Resource Corporation&#x2019;s actual results could differ materially from those discussed in this report. Factors that could cause or contribute to such differences include, but are not limited to, those discussed in the

	Item 1A. Risk Factors

	section of this Form 10-K.

<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The level of demand for our products;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 55.05PT;TEXT-INDENT: -55.1PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC407547157">
</A>
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC408151559">
</A>
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC408151791">
</A>
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC408151921">
</A>
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC408152790">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ITEM
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 40PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	BUSINESS
</FONT>
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM1BUSINESS_437062">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 55.05PT;TEXT-INDENT: -55.1PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC407547158">
</A>
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC408152791">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	History and Organization
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Gold Resource Corporation was organized under the laws of the State of Colorado on August 24, 1998. We are a producer of metal concentrates that contain gold, silver, copper, lead and zinc, and dor&#xE9; containing gold and silver at the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Aguila
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Project in the southern state of Oaxaca, Mexico (&#x201C;Oaxaca&#x201D;). The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Aguila
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Project includes the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Aguila
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	open pit mine, which ceased operations in February 2011, and the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Arista
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	underground mine, which is currently in operation. We also perform exploration and evaluation work on our portfolio of precious and base metal exploration properties in Oaxaca and Nevada, United States of America (&#x201C;Nevada&#x201D;) and continue to evaluate other properties for possible acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In this report, &#x201C;Company,&#x201D; &#x201C;our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201C;us&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and &#x201C;we&#x201D; refer to Gold Resource Corporation together with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our subsidiaries, unless the context otherwise requires.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have two units in North America, the Oaxaca Mining Unit and the Nevada Mining Unit. The majority of our assets are located at our Oaxaca Mining Unit, located on our Aguila Project, including our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Aguila milling facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and Arista underground mine. The Aguila milling facility produces
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	metal concentrates
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	dor&#xE9; from ore mined from the Arista mine, which contains precious metal products of gold and silver, and by-products of copper, lead and zinc.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We perform exploration and evaluation work on our properties within our Nevada Mining Unit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We commenced mining and milling operations at the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Aguila
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Project in July 2010. The mill is located approximately 0.5 kilometers from the Aguila open pit mine.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During 2010, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	also
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	began development of an underground mine to access the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Arista
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	deposit&#x2019;s vein system. The Arista underground mine is located approximately two kilometers from the mill.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Mining of the open pit was essentially completed in 2010.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Approximately one-half of the open pit material was processed in 2010 and the remaining stockpiles are periodically processed with approximately one third remaining. The vast majority of our production from 2011 to present has been from the Arista mine
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In April 2014, we announced the completion of our initial reserve study. Please s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item 2. Properties,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Proven and Probable Reserves
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for more information. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Aguila
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Project includes approximately 30,074 hectares of mining concessions, an access road from a major highway, haul roads, a mill facility and adjoining buildings, an assay lab, an open pit and underground mine, tailings pond and other infrastructure. Please s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item 2. Properties
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	maps and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	additional information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our operations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in Oaxaca
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	are conducted through our Mexican subsidiary, Don David Gold Mexico S.A. de C.V. (&#x201C;DDGM&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our Nevada exploration is done through our wholly-owned subsidiary, GRC Nevada Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our principal executive offices are located 2886 Carriage Manor Point, Colorado Springs, Colorado 80906, and our telephone number is (303) 320-7708. We maintain a website at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	www.goldresourcecorp.com
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and through a link on our website you can view the periodic filings that we make with the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (&#x201C;SEC&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, as well as certain of our corporate governance documents such as our code of ethics
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. The public may read and copy any materials that we file with the SEC at the SEC&#x2019;s Public Reference Room at 100 F Street, NE, Washington, DC 20549. The public may also obtain information on the operation of the Public Reference Room by calling the SEC at 1-800-SEC-0330. The SEC maintains an Internet site that contains reports, proxy and information statements, and other information regarding our filings at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	http://www.sec.gov
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC407547159">
</A>
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC408152792">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Developments During 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	For the year ended December 31, 2015, we reported revenue of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	92.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million, mine gross profit of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	30.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	All of our revenue is from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the Aguila Project
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in Mexico
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our annual 2015 production from the Aguila mill totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	29,644
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	gold ounces,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2,506,337
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	silver ounces,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1,310
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	copper tonnes,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4,174
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	lead tonnes and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	13,900
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	zinc tonnes.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In 2015, dividends distributed to shareholders totaled $0.12 per share or $6.5 million.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	Table of Contents

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Oaxaca Mining Unit
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we continued to deve
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	lop the Arista underground mine
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	reaching Level
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	21
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on the decline ramp by year end. We developed multiple stopes and working faces for mining, predominantly from Levels
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	14
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to Level
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	19
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	during the year. The mining methods of long-hole stoping and cut-and-fill were utilized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	also
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	completed phase three of the tailings impoundment facility which is estimated to provide
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	approximately two and a half years of additional holding capacity. A phase four, in which the existing dam is lifted, is planned during 2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and is estimated to provide
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	additional three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	holding capacity
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Exploration work
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	focused on the Arista deposit, including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	follow-up
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the Switchback
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	vein system
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	which is an area of mineralization approximately 500 meters northeast of the Arista
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	vein system.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	rill res
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ults have intercepted at least seven
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	veins with mineralized material identified al
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ong a strike length of nearly 45
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0 meters and a vertical
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	depth
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	450
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	meters. We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	developed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	an underground drift from Arista toward
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Switchback with a target of reaching the mineralized Switchback veins in 2016.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Mine development plans are in place with a goal of developing additional drifts and declines to prepare for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	extracting
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	mineral
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ized material
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	from Switchback
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the second half of 2016. In addition to testing for water, exploration from the third drill station is expected to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	provide an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	advantageous distance and drill angles to continue exploration work at Switchback
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	This program targets further exploration and delineation of the multiple high-grade parallel veins at Switchback, while continuing to optimize the initial mine plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We also performed exploration at several of our other properties, including a surface drill program on portions of the Alta Gracia and Margaritas properties that focused on previously identified drill targets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Nevada Mining Unit
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On our Radar property in Nevada,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	we conducted detailed and property-wide geologic mapping and geochemical sampling as well as completing an initial 6-hole
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	drill
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	program consisting of 1,985 meters of core drilling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	These holes targeted anomalous gold and mercury&#x2013;bearing structures along a more than two kilometer trend coinciding with numerous histor
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ic mercury mines and prospects.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Results of the exploration efforts indicated potential of bulk-tonnage high-sulfidation style gold mineralization in the northern and eastern portions of the property area where mineralized targets are hosted in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	favorable volcanic tuff units.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Further exploration drilling is under consideration for a more adequate evaluation of the mineralized potential on the Radar property
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In December 2014, t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	he Company leased the &#x201C;Goose&#x201D; gold property directly adjoi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ning the Radar Project from Nevada Eagle LLC.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Goose claims add approximately 100 acres to the Company&#x2019;s Nevada land holdings
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In the fourth quarter of 2015, w
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	e acquired an option to purcha
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	se a property
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	held by Silver Reserve Corporation, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Infrastructure Materials Corp.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We refer to the property as Gold Mesa, a gold bearing property in south central Nevada&#x2019;s Walker Lane Mineral Belt
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We also staked 140 additional unpatented claims surrounding the original Gold Mesa property covering an area of approximately 2,800 acres. The additional claims more than double the land position, which now consists of a total of 4,580 acres, increasing our Nevada exploration potential.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Although there are no work commitments pursuant to the option agreement, we are evaluating a 2016 drill campaign at Gold Mesa
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	he timing will be subject to obtaining the required drill permits with a goal of extending known gold mineralization through infill and step-out drill holes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	All of o
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ur operations in Nevada are in the exploration stage.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We believe
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	that our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Nevada
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	properties are highly prospective based on their proximity to other major gold deposits in the Walker Lane Mineral Belt
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	which are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	known for their significant and high-grade gold-silver
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	production in addition to known
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	mineralization on the properties.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We believe that
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our Nevada
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	properties have excellent potential for discovery of both bulk tonnage replacement-type and bonanza-grade vein-type gold deposits, similar to other gold deposits historically mined in the Paradise Peak and Goldfield districts.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Please s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item 2. Properties
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	maps and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	additional information.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Dividends
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Since July 2010, we have paid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	a monthly dividend
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;W
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	e declared $0.11 per share and paid $0.12 per share in dividends in 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. At the end of 2015, the Board of Directors modified the dividend to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	one-sixth cent per share per month or $0.02 per share per year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Please s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item 5. Market for Registrant&#x2019;s Common Equity, Related Stockholder Matters and Issuer Purchase of Equity Securities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for additional information
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Condition of Physical Assets and Insurance
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our business is capital intensive and requires ongoing capital investment for the replacement, modernization or expansion of equipment and fac
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ilities. For more information, please s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item 7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Management&#x2019;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations, Liquidity and Capital Resources
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, below. We maintain insurance policies against property loss and business interruption and insure against risks that are typical in the operation of our business in amounts that we believe to be reasonable. Such insurance, however, contains exclusions and limitations on coverage, particularly with respect to loss, environmental liability and political risk. There can be no assurance that claims would be paid under such insurance policies in connection with a particular event.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Please s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item 1A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Risk Factors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, below for additional information
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC407547165">
</A>
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC408152798">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Environmental Matters
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We conduct our operations so as to protect the environment and believe our operations are in compliance with applicable laws and regulations in all material respects. Our operating mine has a reclamation plan in place that we believe meets all applicable legal and regulatory requirements. At December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million was accrued for reclamation costs relating to current or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	previously
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	producing properties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC408152800">
</A>
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC407547167">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Competitive Business Conditions
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The exploration for, and the acquisition of, gold and silver properties are subject to intense competition. Identifying and evaluating potential mining prospects is a costly and time-consuming endeavor. Due to our limited capital and personnel, we are at a competitive disadvantage compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	many other companies with regard to exploration and, if warranted, advancement of mining properties. Our present limited capital means that our ability to compete for properties to be explored and developed is limited. We believe that competition for acquiring mineral prospects will continue to be intense in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC408152801">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Government Regulations and Permits
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In connection with mining, milling and exploration activities, we are subject to United States and Mexican federal, state and local laws and regulations governing the protection of the environment, including laws and regulations relating to protection of air and water quality, hazardous waste management and mine reclamation as well as the protection of endangered or threatened species. The department responsible for environmental protection in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Mexico is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Secretaria de Medio Ambiente y Recursos Naturales
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(&#x201C;SEMARNAT&#x201D;), which is similar to the United States Environmental Protection A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	gency.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	SEMARNAT has broad authority to shut down and/or levy fines against facilities that do not comply with its environm
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ental regulations or standards.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Potential areas of environmental consideration for mining companies, including ours, include but are not limited to, acid rock drainage, cyanide containment and handling, contamination of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	water sources, dust and noise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In connection with our mill and mining operations at the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Aguila
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Project, we have
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and intend to secure
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	various regulatory permits from federal, state and local agencies. These governmental and regulatory permits generally govern the processes being used to operate, the stipulations concerning air quality and water issues, and the plans and obligations for reclamation of the properties at the conclusion of operations. Regulations require that an environmental impact statement, known in Mexico as a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Manifiestacion de Impacto Ambiental
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(&#x201C;MIA&#x201D;), be prepared by a third-party contractor for submission to SEMARNAT. We have
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	submitted our MIA to SEMARNAT for its review, and it has been approved.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Studies required to support the MIA include a detailed analysis of these areas, among others: soil, water, vegetation, wildlife, cultural resources and socio-economic impacts. Although the regulatory process in Mexico has a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	public review component, proof of local community support for a project is required to gain final MIA approval. We have received the required local community support
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Aguila
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;P
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	roject in the area from which we are currently producing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have obtained in the past, and plan to obtain at the appropriate time, environmental permits, licenses or approvals required for operations. We are not aware of any material violations of environmental permits, licenses or approvals issued with respect to our operations.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In connection with exploration activities in Nevada, we are subject to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	various federal and state laws and regulations governing protection of the environment, including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, but not limited to,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the Clean Air Act; the Clean Water Act; the Comprehensive Environmental Response
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Compensation and Liability Act; the Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act; the Endangered Species Act; the Federal Land Policy and Management Act; the National Environmental Policy Act; the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act; and related state laws. These laws and regulations are continually changing and are generally becoming more restrictive. Our activities outside the United States are also subject to various levels of governmental regulations for the protection of the environment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	I
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	n some cases, those regulations can be as, or more, restrictive than those in the United States.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC407547168">
</A>
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC408152802">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Customers
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During the year ended December
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	85% of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our revenue was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	generated from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the sales of metals concentrate to Consorcio Minero de Mexico Cormin Mex. S.A. de C.V., a Trafigura Group Company (&#x201C;Trafigura&#x201D;).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During the same period, 15% of our revenue was generated from the sales of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	gold and silver dor&#xE9; bars
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to Asahi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Refining USA, Inc. (&#x201C;Asahi Refining
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D;). In the event that our relationship
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	with either
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Trafigura or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Asahi Refining
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	is interrupted for any reason, we believe that we would be able to locat
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	e another entity to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	purchase our preciou
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s metals and by-product metals.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	However, any interruption could temporarily disrupt the sale of our principal products and adversely affect our operating results. We periodically review our options of alternative sales outlets to mitigate the concentration of risk in case of any unforeseen disruptions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC407547169">
</A>
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC408152803">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Employees and Contractors
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We currently have
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	twelve
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	full-time employees, six of which serve as our executive officers. These individuals devote all of their business time to our affairs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We contract for the services of appr
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	oximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	400
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	individuals employed by a third party and also use various independent contractors for constructing our underground mine, surface exploration drilling and trucking
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_BUSINESS>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_RISK_FACTORS>
<A NAME="FIS_RISK_FACTORS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 55.45PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-55.45PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ITEM 1A.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	RISK FACTORS
</FONT>
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM1ARISKFACTORS_245571">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 55.45PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-55.45PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	This report, including Management&#x2019;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations, contains forward-looking statements that may be materially affected by several risk factors, including those summarized below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC407547171">
</A>
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC408152805">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Risks Relating to Our Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our existing production is limited to a single mine and any interruptions or stoppages in our mining activities would adversely affect our revenue.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are presently relying on a single mine to provide mineralized material for processing at our mill facility which we sell to fund our operations. Any interruption in our ability to mine this location, such as a labor strike, natural disaster, or loss of permits would negatively impact our ability to collect revenue following such interruption. Additionally, if we are unable to economically develop additional mines, we will eventually deplete the body of mineralized material and will no longer generate revenue sufficient to fund our operations. A decrease in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	or cessation of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our mining operations would adversely affect our financial performance and may eventually cause us to cease operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
</FONT>
</P>

<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#GORO-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	If we are unable to achieve gold and silver production levels anticipated from our Aguila Project, our financial condition and results of operation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	will be adversely affected.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have proceeded with the processing of the mineralized material from the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Arista
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	underground mine at the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Aguila
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Project
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	based on estimates of mineralized material identified during exploration
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in our Proven and Probable Reserve report
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. However, risks related to metallurgy are inherent when working with extractable minerals. Sales of gold and silver that we realize from future mining activity will be less than anticipated if the mined material does not contain the concentration of gold and silver predicted by our geological exploration,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	studies and reports
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. If sales of gold and silver are less than anticipated, we may not be able to recover our investment in our property and our operations may be adversely affected. Our inability to realize production based on quarterly or annual projections may also adversely affect the price of our common stock and you may lose all or part of your investment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	The volatility of the price of gold and silver could adversely affect our future operations and, if warranted, our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ability to develop our properties.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The profitability of our operations, the value of our properties and our ability to raise funding to conduct continued exploration and mine construction, if warranted, are directly related to the market price of gold, silver and other base metals. The price of gold and silver may also have a significant influence on the market price of our common stock. Our decision to put a mine into production and to commit the funds necessary for that purpose must be made long before the first revenue from production would be received. A decrease in the prices of gold and silver may prevent our properties from being economically mined or result in the write-off of assets whose value is impaired as a result of lower commodity prices. The volatility in gold and silver prices is illustrated by the following table, which sets forth for each of the past five calendar years, the average annual market prices in U.S. dollars per ounce of gold and silver based on the daily London P.M. fix:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:48.95PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:48.95PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The price of gold and silver is affected by numerous factors beyond our control, including inflation, fluctuation of the United States dollar and foreign currencies, global and regional demand, the sale of gold and silver by central banks, and the political and economic conditions of major gold and silver producing countries throughout the world.&nbsp;&nbsp;Accordingly
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	no amount of planning or technical expertise can fully eliminate these risks. In the event gold or silver prices decline or remain low for prolonged periods of time, we might be unable to develop our properties, which may adversely affect our results of operations, financial performance and cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Estimates of proven and probable reserves and mineralized material are uncertain and the volume and grade of ore actually recovered may vary from our estimates.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	proven and probable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	reserves
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and mineralized material
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	stated in this report represent the amount of gold
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, silver,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	copper
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, lead and zinc
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	that we estimated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	at December 31, 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	could be economically
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and legally extracted or produced at the time of the reserv
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	e d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	etermination
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Estimates of proven and probable reserves
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and mineralized material
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	are subject to considerable uncertainty.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Such estimates are, to a large extent, based on the prices of gold
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	silver, copper, lead and zinc
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and interpretations of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	geologic data obtained from drill holes and other exploration techniques.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Additionally, the term &#x201C;mineralized material&#x201D; as used in this report does not indicate proven and probable reserves as defined by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Industry
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Guide 7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(&#x201C;Guide 7&#x201D;) promulgated by the SEC
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	standards. Estimates of mineralized material are subject to furth
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	er exploration and development and are therefore
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	subject to considerable uncertainty.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	cannot be certain that any part or parts of the mineralized material deposit will ever be confirmed or converted into Guide 7 compliant reserves or that mineralized material can be economically or legally extracted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	I
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	f the price
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of gold or silver
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	declines from recent levels, if production costs increase or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	recovery rates decrease
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	or if applicable laws and regulations are adversely changed, we can offer no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	assurance that the indicated level of recovery will be realized or that mineral reserves as currently reported can be mined or processed profitably. If we determine
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	that a portion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ore reserves become uneconomic, this may ultimately lead to a reduction in our reported reserves
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Consequently, if our actual mineral reserves are less than current estimates, our business, prospects, results of operations and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	financial position may be materially impaired.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

</P>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#GORO-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our current property portfolio is limited to a single producing property and our ability to remain profitable over the long-term will depend on our ability to expand the known deposits like Arista and /or identify, explore and develop additional properties
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Gold and silver producers must continually replace reserves depleted by production to maintain production levels over the long term and provide a return on invested capital. Depleted reserves can be replaced in several ways, including expanding known ore bodies, locating new deposits, or acquiring interests in reserves from third parties. Exploration is highly speculative in nature, capital intensive, involves many risks and is frequently unproductive. Our current or future exploration programs may not result in new mineral producing operations. Even if significant mineralization is discovered, it will likely take many years from the initial phases of exploration until commencement of production, during which time the economic feasibility of production may change.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As a result of these uncertainties, our exploration programs and any acquisitions which we may pursue may not result in the expansion or replacement of our current production with new ore reserves or operations, which could have a material adverse effect on our business, prospects, results of operations and financial position.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We have incurred substantial losses in the past and may not continue to be profitable.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During the fiscal years ended December
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2015, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we reported
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	comprehensive
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	15.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million, respectively. We have accumulated retained
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	deficit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(0.9)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million as of Dec
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ember
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2015. The downward trend in metal prices in recent years has caused a significant decrease in our profit margin and there is no assurance that we will be profitable in the future. Unexpected interruptions in our mining business may cause us to incur losses, or the revenue that we generate from production may not be sufficient to fund continuing operations including exploration and mine construction costs. Our failure to generate future profits may adversely affect the price of our common stock and you may lose all or part of your investment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We may require significant additional capital to fund our business plan.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We may be required to expend significant funds to determine if
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	mineralized material and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	proven and probable mineral reserves exist at any of our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	non-producing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	properties, to continue exploration, and if warranted, develop our existing properties and to identify and acquire additional properties to diversify our property portfolio. We have spent, and may be required to continue to expend, significant amounts of capital for drilling, geological and geochemical analysis, assaying and feasibility studies in connection with our exploration. We may not benefit from these investments if we are unable to identify commercially exploitable mineralized material.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our ability to obtain necessary funding for these purposes, in turn, depends upon a number of factors, including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our historical and prospective results of operations,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the status of the national and worldwide economy, the price of gold, silver and other valuable metals
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and the costs associated with extracting them
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. The mining sector has been negatively impacted by a general decline in metal prices over the last
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years. We may not be successful in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	generating or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	obtaining the required financing, or if we can obtain such financing, such financing may not be on terms that are favorable to us. Failure to obtain such additional financing could result in delay or indefinite postponement of further mining operations or exploration and construction and the possible partial or total loss of our potential interest in our properties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue from the sale of our metals may be adversely affected by loss or damage during shipment and storage at our buyer&#x2019;s facilities.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	rely on third-party transportation companies to transport our metals to the buyer&#x2019;s facilities for processing and further refining. The terms of our sales contracts with the buyers require us to rely on assay results from samples of our metals that are obtained at the buyer&#x2019;s warehouse to determine the final sales value for our metals. Once the metal leaves our mill facility, we no longer have direct custody and control of these products. Theft, loss, automobile accidents, improper storage, fire, natural disasters, tampering or other unexpected events while in transit or at the buyer&#x2019;s location may lead to the loss of all or a portion of our metal products. Such losses may not be covered by insurance and may lead to a delay or interruption in our revenue and our operating results may be adversely affected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Exploration
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	if deemed feasible, development of mineral properties is inherently risky and could lead to unproductive properties and/or capital investments.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our long-term success depends on our ability to identify additional mineral deposits on our properties at our Oaxaca Mining Unit or our Nevada Mining Unit and any other properties that we have or may acquire and to develop one or more of those properties into commercially viable mining operations. Mineral exploration is highly speculative in nature, involves many risks and is frequently unproductive. These risks
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	include unusual or unexpected geologic formations and the inability to obtain suitable or adequate machinery, equipment or labor. The success of gold exploration is determined in part by the following factors:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">

<P STYLE="WIDTH:24PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
