</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Impairment of Long-Lived Assets
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company evaluates its long-lived assets for impairment when events or changes in circumstances indicate that the related carrying amounts may not be recoverable. Asset impairment is considered to exist if the total estimated future cash flows on an undiscounted basis are less than th
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	e carrying amount of the asset. If an impairment is indicated, a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ny impairment losses are measured and recorded based on discounted estimated future cash flows and are charged to expense on the Company&#x2019;s consolidated statements of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and comprehensive income. In estimating future cash flows, assets are grouped at the lowest level for which there are identifiable cash flows that are largely independent of future cash flows from other asset groups. The Company&#x2019;s estimates of future cash flows are based on numerous assumptions, including expected gold and other commodity prices, production levels, capital requirements and estimated salvage values
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Existing reserves
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and other mineralized material
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	are included when estimating the fair value in determining whether the assets are impaired. The Company&#x2019;s estimates of future cash flows are based on numerous assumptions and it is possible that actual future cash flows will be significantly different than the estimates, as actual future quantities of recoverable minerals, gold and other commodity prices, production levels and costs and capital are each subject to significant risks and uncertainties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Treasury Stock
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:40.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Treasury stock represents shares of the Company&#x2019;s common stock which has been repurchased on the open market at the prevailing market price at the time of purchase. Treasury stock is shown at cost as a separate component of equity as a deduction from total capital stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:40.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue Recognition&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company recognizes revenue when an arrangement exists, the price is fixed and determinable, the title and risk of loss have transferred to the buyer and co
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	llection is reasonably assured.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	55
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage56"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#GORO-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Concentrate sales
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Concentrate sales are initially recorded using quoted metal prices at the time of shipment and contain an embedded derivative that is required to be separated from the host contract for accounting purposes. The host contract is the receivable from the sale of the concentrates at the quoted metal prices at the time of shipment. The embedded derivative, which does not qualify for hedge accounting, is adjusted to market through revenue each period prior to final settlement. Changes in the prices of metals that the Company sells, as quoted on the London Bullion Market, between the shipment and final settlement dates will result in adjustments to revenues related to sales of concentrate previously recorded upon shipment. Sales are recorded net of charges for treatment, refining, smelting losses and other charges negotiated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the buyer. These charges are estimated upon shipment of concentrates based on contractual terms and adjusted to reflect actual charges at final settlement.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Historically, actual charges have not varied materially from the Company&#x2019;s initial estimates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Dor&#xE9;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	sales
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	: Dor&#xE9; sales are recognized using quoted metal prices
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, net of treatment and refining charges,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	when the title has been transferred and collection of the sales price is reasonably assured.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Production Costs
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Production costs include labor and benefits, royalties, concentrate and dor&#xE9; shipping costs, mining subcontractors, fuel and lubricants, legal and professional fees related to mine operations, stock-based compensation attributable to mine workers, materials and supplies, repairs and maintenance, explosives, housing and food, insurance, reagents, travel, medical services, security equipment, office rent, tools and other costs that support mining operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Exploration Costs
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Exploration costs are charged to expense as incurred.&nbsp;Costs to identify new mineral resources, to evaluate potential resources, and to convert mineral resources into proven and probable reserves are considered exploration costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Stock-Based Compensation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company records compensation expense for the fair value of stock options that are granted. Expense is recognized on a straight-line basis over the vesting periods, if any, of the options. The fair value of each option award is estimated on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option pricing model, which requires the input of subjective assumptions including expected volatility of the underlying stock, risk-free interest rates, the expected life of the option, dividend yields and expected forfeitures and cancellations. Expected volatility is based on the historical price volatility of the Company&#x2019;s common stock.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Risk-free interest rates are based on U.S. government obligations with a term approximating the expected life of the option. The expected life is estimated in accordance with SEC Staff Accounting Bulletin No. 107, &#x201C;Share-Based Payment&#x201D;. The Company paid dividends beginning in July 2010, and accordingly, a dividend yield was considered in calculating the grant date fair value of options granted subsequent to that date; however, no dividend yield was considered for options granted prior to July 2010.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In addition, the Company estimates the expected forfeiture rate and only recognizes expense for those options expected to vest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Reclamation and Remediation Costs
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Reclamation costs are allocated to expense over the life of the related assets and are periodically adjusted to reflect changes in the estimated present value resulting from the passage of time and revisions to the estimates of either the timing or amount of the reclamation and remediation costs. Reclamation obligations are based on when the spending for an existing environmental disturbance will occur. The Company reviews, on at least an annual basis, the reclamation obligation at each mine.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Prior to 2014, the Company had been recognizing only reclamation and remediation obligations and all associated asset retirement costs were written off due to the exploration stage status of the Company. In 2014, the Company became a production stage company and therefore capitalized asset retirement costs and recorded an asset retirement obligation. Please see
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 11
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for additional information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	56
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage57"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#GORO-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Accounting for reclamation and remediation obligations requires management to make estimates unique to each mining operation of the future costs expected to be incurred to complete the reclamation and remediation work required to comply with existing laws and regulations. Actual costs incurred in future periods could differ from amounts estimated. Additionally, future changes to environmental laws and regulations could increase the extent of reclamation and remediation work required. Any such increases in future costs could materially impact the amounts charged to earnings for reclamation and remediation.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Comprehensive Income
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Accumulated o
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ther comprehensive income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	is presented in the consolidated statements of cha
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	nges in shareholders&#x2019; equity.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Accumulated o
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ther comprehensive income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	is composed of foreign currency translation adjustment effects related to the historical adjustment when the functional currency was the Mexican peso.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income and Mining Royalty Taxes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	Income taxes are computed using the asset and liability method. Deferred income taxes reflect the net tax effects of temporary differences between the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities for financial and tax reporting purposes and the effect of net operating loss and foreign tax credit carry-forwards using enacted tax rates in effect in the years in which the differences are expected to reverse. Deferred tax assets are evaluated to determine if it is more likely than not that they will be realized.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	Please see
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	Note 5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	for additional information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Net Income Per Share
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Diluted income per share reflects the dilution that could occur if potentially dilutive securities, as determined using the treasury stock method, a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	re converted into common stock.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Potentially dilutive securities, such as stock options and warrants, are excluded from the calculation when their inclusion would be anti-dilutive, such as periods when a net loss is reported or when the exercise price of the instrument exceeds the average fair market value.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Foreign Currency
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The functional currency for all of the Company&#x2019;s subsidiaries is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the United States dollar (&#x201C;US dollar
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Concentration of Credit Risk
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company has considered and assessed the credit risk resulting from its concentrate sales and dor&#xE9; sales arrangements with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	its customers,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Trafigura and As
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	hi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Refining,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and believes it is not exposed to significant credit risk in relation to the counterparty meeting its contractual obligations as it pertains to its trade receivables during the ordinary course of business. In the event that the Company&#x2019;s relationship
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Trafigura and Ashai
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Refining
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	interrupted for any reason, the Company believes that it would be able to locate another entity to purchase its metals concentrates and dor&#xE9; bars
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	; ho
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	wever, any interruption could temporarily disrupt the Company&#x2019;s sale of its products and adversely affect operating results.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Aguila
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Project, which is located in the State of Oaxaca, Mexico, accounted for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	100%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of the Company&#x2019;s total sales for the years ended December 31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Some of the Company&#x2019;s operating cash balances are maintained in accounts that currently e
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	xceed federally insured limits.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company believes that the financial strength of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	depositing institutions mitiga
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	te the underlying risk of loss.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	To date, these concentrations of credit risk have not had a significant impact on the Company&#x2019;s financial position or results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC407547208">
</A>
<A NAME="GORO-20151231X10K_HTM__TOC408152843">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Recently Issued Accounting Standards Updates
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Accounting Standards Update No. 2014-09&#x2014;Revenue from Contracts with Customers (Topic 606).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On May 28, 2014, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#x201C;FASB&#x201D;) issued guidance that requires an entity to recognize the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	57
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage58"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#GORO-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	amount of revenue to which it expects to be entitled for the transfer of promised goods or services to customers. The guidance will replace most existing revenue recognition guidance when it becomes effective. The new standard is effectiv
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	e for the Company on September
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1, 2017, and early application is not permitted. The standard permits the use of either the retrospective or cumulative
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	effect transition method.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	The Company does not anticipate any significant changes due to the implementation of this update, as there are no complex contractual arrangements with current customers, therefore our current revenue recognition model is not expected to change.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Accounting Standards Update No. 2015-11 Inventory (&#x201C;Topic 330&#x201D;).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Topic 330 Inventory, currently requires an entity to measure inventory at the lower of cost or market. Market could be replacement cost, net realizable value, or net realizable value less an approximately normal profit margin. The amendments in this Update require an entity to measure inventory within the scope of this Update at the lower of cost and net realizable value. For public business entities, the amendments in this Update are effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2016, including interim periods within those fiscal years. The Company does not anticipate any significant changes due to the implementation of this update.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Accounting Standards Update
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	No.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	2015-17 Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	(Topic 740).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	I
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	n November, 2015, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	FASB issued guidance that
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	requires registrants to classify deferred tax assets and liabilities as non-current items on the balance sheet instead of disclosing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	the current portion separately.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	This change was made because the classification used in the past generally did not align with the time period in which registrants expected to recover or settle the r
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	elated assets and liabilities.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	As a result, presentation has been simplified. The Company has elected to adop
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	t this update retrospectively.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	Accordingly, the Company's deferred tax assets and liabilities have been classified as non-current items on the b
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	alance sheets presented herein.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	The impact in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	2014 was a reduction of current assets and an increase in non-current assets of $3.9 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Accounting Standards Update
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	No. 2016-02 Leases (Topic 842).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	I
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	n
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	February
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	, 2016, the FASB issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	a new standard regarding leases
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	. There are elements of the new standard that could impact almost all entities to some extent, although lessees will likely see the most significant changes. Lessees will need to recognize virtually all of their leases on the balance sheet, by recording a right-of-use asset and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	&nbsp;a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	lease liability. Public business entities are required to adopt the new leasing standard for fiscal years, and interim periods within those fiscal years, beginning after December 15, 2018. For calendar year-end public companies, this means an adoptio
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	n date of January 1, 2019. Early adoption is permitted. The C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	ompany has not yet performed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	assessment of the impact on the financial statements and disclosures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2. Fair Value Measurement
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:26.15PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	Fair value accounting establishes a fair value hierarchy that prioritizes the inputs to valuation techniques used to measure fair value. The hierarchy gives the highest priority to unadjusted quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities (Level 1 measurements) and the lowest priority to unobservable inputs (Level 3 measurements). The three levels of the fair value hierarchy are described below:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:26.15PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	Level 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 15PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	Unadjusted quoted prices in active markets that are accessible at the measurement date for identical, unrestricted assets or liabilities;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	Level 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 15PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	Quoted prices in markets that are not active, or inputs that are observable, either directly or indirectly, for substantially the full term of the asset or liability; and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	Level 3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 15PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;">
	Prices or valuation techniques that require inputs that are both significant to the fair value measurement and unobservable (supported by little or no market activity.)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:26.15PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The following tables set forth certain of the Company&#x2019;s assets measured at fair value by level within the fair value hierarchy. As required by accounting guidance, assets are classified in their entirety based on the lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value measurement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH: 100.00%;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;">
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	58
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#GORO-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<EFX_BALANCE_SHEET>
<A NAME="FIS_BALANCE_SHEET_2"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH: 100.00%;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:36.54%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:01.54%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:01.54%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">

</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:05.38%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:01.54%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:01.54%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:05.90%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:01.54%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:05.38%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
<DIV STYLE="FLOAT:LEFT">
</DIV>
	2,389
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:01.54%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;

<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:27.06%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Investments
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:00.52%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">

</DIV>
</EFX_BALANCE_SHEET>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:25.9PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Cash and cash equivalents consist primarily of money market funds and are valued at cost, which approximates fair value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:25.9PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:25.9PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Trade accounts receivable include amounts due to the Company for shipments of concentrates and dor&#xE9; sold to customers. Concentrate sales contracts provide for provisional pricing as specified in such contracts. These sales contain an embedded derivative related to the provisional pricing mechanism which is bifurcated and accounted for as a derivative. At the end of each reporting period, the Company records an adjustment to sales to reflect the mark-to-market of outstanding provisional invoices. Because these provisionally priced sales have not yet settled as of the reporting date, the mark-to-market adjustment related to these invoices is included in accounts receivable as of each reporting date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:25.9PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:25.9PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s current investments consist of marketable equity securities which are valued using quoted market prices for each security when available.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:25.9PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:26.15PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Gains and losses related to changes in the fair value of these financial instruments were included in the Company&#x2019;s consolidated statements of income as shown in the following table
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:26.15PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_INCOME_STATEMENT>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 55.45PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-55.45PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3. Gold and Silver Bullion
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 55.45PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-55.45PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:27PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Company periodically purchases gold and silver bullion on the open market for investment purposes and to use in its dividend exchange program under which shareholders may exchange their cash dividend for gold and silver bullion.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	During the twelve months ended December 31, 2015, the Company made
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	purchases of gold or silver bullion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:27PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:27.35PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The Company&#x2019;s investment in gold and silver bullion is carried at the lower of cost or market
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	; please s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ee N
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ote 17
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for information regarding the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	write-downs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on the gold and silver bullion inventory.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	At December 31, 2015 and 2014, the Company&#x2019;s holdings of bullion consisted of the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:27.35PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	5. Income Taxes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	he Company files income taxes on an entity basis. Gold Resource Corporation and its U.S. subsidiary file a consolidated U.S. tax return
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(&#x201C;U.S. Operations&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and the Company&#x2019;s foreign subsidiary files in Mexico
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(&#x201C;Foreign Operations, Mexico&#x201D;.)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	For financial reporting purposes, net income before income taxes includes the following components:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:07.36%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	December
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	2013, the Mexican President approved a tax reform bill that enacted a new Income Tax Law (&#x201C;MITL&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	, which increased the effective income tax rate applicable to the Company&#x2019;s Mexican operations effective January 1, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	. Under the reform, the corporate income tax rate remained at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	30%; p
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	reviously enacted reductions of the tax rate over the next two years to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	28%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	were eliminated. The reform also introduced a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	10%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	withholding tax on dividends paid to non-resident shareholders (allows for relief under certain of Mexico's tax treaties).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As part of the tax reform bill,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	two new mining duties
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	were introduced
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in addition to the existing tax on mining property based on the size of the mining property: (i) a "special" mining duty of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	7.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of taxable income as defined under Mexican tax law
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(also referred to as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	mining royalty
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	tax&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	) on extracting activities performed by concession holders and (ii) the "extraordinary" mining duty of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on the gross revenue from the sale of gold, silver and platinum.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	mining
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	royalty tax
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	generally applicable to earnings before income tax, depreciation, depletion, amortization, and interest. In calculating the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	mining
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	royalty tax, there are no deductions related to depreciable costs from operational fixed assets, but exploration and prospecting depreciable costs are deductible when incurred.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Both duties are tax deductible for income tax purposes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	s a result of the tax reforms, m
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	ining entities are subject to the special mining
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	royalty tax
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	of 7.5% in addition to the 30% corporate income tax which increased the effective tax rate applicable to the Company&#x2019;s Mexican operations effective January 1, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company recorded a non-cash charge of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$0.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million related to the deferred tax impacts of the above tax changes for the year ended December 31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Undistributed earnings of the Company&#x2019;s foreign subsidiaries were approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$36.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million at December 31, 2015. These earnings are considered indefinitely reinvested, and do not include earnings which are considered distributed. Accordingly, no provision for U.S. federal and state income taxes has been provided for on those earnings. These additional foreign earnings could be subject to additional tax if remitted, or deemed remitted, as a dividend; however, it is not practicable to estimate the additional amount, if any, of taxes payable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company distributed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$3.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$24.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$17.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million from the Mexican operation to the U.S. operation in 2015, 2014, and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	No
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	US tax was paid on the distributions because the Company claimed foreign tax credits against these earnings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	61

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company, on an entity-by-entity basis, evaluates the evidence available to determine whether a valuation allowance is requi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	red on the deferred tax assets.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Company determined that the deferred tax asset related to the state net operating loss carry forwards were not "more likely than not" to be realized and recorded a valuation allowance related to net operating loss carry forwards of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$0.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$0.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectively, for the years ended December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.30%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	At December
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	31, 2015, the Company has U.S. tax loss carry-forwards for U. S. tax purposes approximating
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	30.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million, which expire between 202
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1 and 2025, and foreign tax credits of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$5.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million that expire between 2022 and 2025.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of December 31, 2015, the Company belie
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ves that it has no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	uncertain tax positions. If the Company were to d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	etermine there was an uncertain tax position, the Company would recognize the liability and related interest and penalties within income tax expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s largest deferred tax asset arose from exploration costs incurred in the Mexican operation through December 31, 2013, when the Company transitioned to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	a Production Stage Enterprise.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	These costs were expensed when they were incurred on the Company&#x2019;s financial statements as required by US GAAP
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	but are capitalized and depreciated under Mexican tax law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company transferred fixed assets from the U.S. parent to its Mexico subsidiary within the consolidated group in 2013. This transfer created a difference in the tax basis of the assets in our Mexico subsidiary tax jurisdiction and consolidated financial statement carrying amounts. The net tax effect of this intercompany transaction is deferred in consolidation and recorded as a deferred charge
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. This charge is being amortized to income tax expense over
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years to eliminate the deferred tax impact for the intercompany transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Currently the Company is undergoing a tax examination by the Mexican tax authorities that spans back to 2011 and 2012 tax years. The tax examinations are open and ongoing and no further information has been communicated to the Company by the Mexican tax authorities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 24.5PT;TEXT-INDENT: -24.5PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:27PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Depletion, depreciation and amortization expense for years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013 was $9.1 million, $4.6 million and $2.6 million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	8. Investments in Equity Securities
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	At December 31, 2015 and 2014,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the Company&#x2019;s investment in non-current e
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	quity securities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	consisted of a common stock investment of Laguna Gold Pty Ltd of $0.2 million. The Company determined that it is not practicable to estimate the fair value of this investment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 8PT;">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#GORO-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">

	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	12. Commitments and Contingencies
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Litigation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On December 30, 2015, a former contractor filed a lawsuit against the Company&#x2019;s subsidiary, Don David Gold Mexico S.A. de C.V., in district court in Oaxaca, Mexico. The lawsuit was brought under provisions of the Mexican Commercial Code alleging that work was performed by the contractor for which it had not been paid. The Company has denied the allegations on the basis that the work was not performed. While the ultimate outcome and impact on the Company cannot be predicted with certainty and management believes that the resolution of pending proceedings will not have a material adverse effect on the Company&#x2019;s consolidated financial condition, results of operations, or cash flows. Therefore, no liability has been recorded at December 31, 2015. The Company continues to vigorously defend its position in Mexican court
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Operating leases
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:22.3PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In 2014, the Company sold the building that serves as its executive and administrative headquarters in Colorado Springs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, Colorado
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and has leased a portion back under a renewable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-year lease.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The lease was renewed in 2015.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company also leases an office in Denver, Colorado consisting of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	square feet, which was renewed in 2015 for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. The Company&#x2019;s Mexico subsidiary leases office space in Oaxaca City, Oaxaca. The subsidiary entered into a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	year lease commencing January 1, 2012.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s known
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	obligations at December
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	31, 2015, are set forth in the table below
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	: &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 16.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 8PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:2PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:2PT;WIDTH:2PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 8PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	Amounts represent principal of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	0.8 million, a bargain purchase option for less than $0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	and estimated interest payments of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	less than $0.1 million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	assuming
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	no early extinguishment. The Company has equipment leases that qualify as capital leases which have been recorded at the present value of the future minimum lease payments, including transaction fees and bargain purchase options, which approximates the net carrying value of the equipment. The equipment leases bear interest at 4.5% to 5.5% per annum, with monthly principal and interest payments of approximately $0.1 million over the three-year lease term. The Company has an option to purchase the equipment at the end of the lease term for less than $0.1 million. Depreciation on the leased assets is recorded over their estimated useful lives.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	$6.5

	million and paid dividends of
</FONT>

	million and paid dividends of

	million.

	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-sixth cent per share per month or $0.02 per share per year
</FONT>
